Justinian enacted that in no case should co-legatees oi the same thing be entitled, the one to it, the other or rest to its value, ‘nisi testator apertissime et expressim disposuerit, ut uni quidem res solida, aliis autem aestimatio rei singulis in solidum praestetur’ Cod. 6. 51. 11. As Gaius remarks (ii. 206), an important modification was made in the law os accrual between coheirs and co-legatees by the leges lulia and Papia Poppaea, sor which see on Tit. 14 pt. supr.; these statutes‚ however, were no longer in force under Justinian, who speaks of the caducitas which they introduced as altogether abolished from his system, Cod 1. 17. 7, Const. Tanta a. 6.
